meanings.definition: A low-frequency sound or tone, typically below 60 Hz.
meanings.sent1: The subbass in the movie theater made the floor vibrate.
meanings.sent2: The subbass in this song is so deep, you can feel it in your chest.
meanings.sent3: The subbass was so powerful that it shook loose a painting from the wall.
meanings.sent4: The subbass rumbled through the room like a distant thunderstorm.
meanings.sent5: The subbass was like a giant invisible hand pushing against your body.

meanings.definition: The lowest part of the bass range in music.
meanings.sent1: The subbass adds depth to the music, creating a rich sound.
meanings.sent2: In this orchestra piece, the subbass provides a solid foundation.
meanings.sent3: The subbass was so low, it made the audience's chairs vibrate.
meanings.sent4: The subbass resonated like the heartbeat of the music.
meanings.sent5: The subbass filled the room with a warm, comforting hum.

meanings.definition: A speaker or audio system designed to reproduce very low frequencies.
meanings.sent1: The subbass in the car audio system made the windows rattle.
meanings.sent2: This subbass speaker delivers powerful, deep tones.
meanings.sent3: The subbass speaker was so strong, it shook the whole room.
meanings.sent4: The subbass system boomed like a distant drum in the night.
meanings.sent5: The subbass speaker throbbed with a steady, low-frequency pulse.
